headline: Football Jell-O Shots

reviewedBy.name: Delish Test Kitchen
reviewedBy.description: Delish is known for developing the most creative and outrageously good food on the planet. Each recipe is meticulously tested and perfected by our team of culinary experts, ensuring they’ll always be completely foolproof and totally fun.

video.name: Celebrate The Big Game With Touchdown Punch

description: Rum and coke-flavored Jell-O shots in hollowed-out lime shells are decorated with icing to look like footballs.

author.name: Brooke Caison
author.description:
Expertise: Dinners & Appetizers

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Culinary Arts Diploma from The Institute of Culinary Education

About Me: As a food editor at Delish, Brooke pitches, develops, and styles original recipes for photo shoots, serving as Delish’s go-to food stylist for dramatic cheese pull. She also hosts recipe videos and writes a weekly membership dinners newsletter. Her viral recipes include Cranberry Whipped Feta, Sugarplum Spritz, and Cottage Cheese Alfredo—her videos have garnered over 7 million views on TikTok and IG. Before Delish, Brooke assisted Top Chef judge and culinary expert Gail Simmons, wrote articles for Martha Stewart.com, and launched a Food & Beverage Program for Little Island Park in NYC. She appears regularly as an expert on TV, including The Food Network as a Guest Judge on Guy Fieri’s Best Bite In Town and on The History Channel’s The Food That Built America. Outside the kitchen, you can find her dabbling in acrylic painting, hiking in upstate New York, or running around Prospect Park with her husky Juneau.
Follow her on TikTok @brookesgonnacook and see more at brookeolivia.work
author.jobTitle: Food Editor & Host of “Brooke’s One Pots”

name: Football Jell-O Shots
recipeIngredient: Store-bought tube of cookie icing, for decorating

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan over high heat, bring 12 ounces Coke to a boil. Continue to boil until reduced to about 2 ounces, about 25 minutes. Transfer to a small bowl.

Meanwhile, juice limes, reserving 1/2 ounce juice. Working one at a time, turn each lime half inside out. Starting at either end of each half, using a paper towel or clean dishcloth, peel back the layer of white fiber between peel and lime flesh, remove, and discard. Rinse each lime half with cold water, pat dry, and transfer to 2 standard 12-cup muffin tins.
Into same saucepan, pour remaining 6 ounces Coke and sprinkle gelatin over. Gently stir to combine, then cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until powder dissolves, about 5 minutes.

Pour gelatin mixture into a large glass measuring cup. Add Coke syrup, rum, and reserved 1/2 ounce lime juice and stir to combine. Making sure each lime is level, divide Coke mixture among lime shells. Wrap muffin tins with plastic wrap and refrigerate until Jell-O is set, about 4 hours.
Slice each Jell-O lime in half lengthwise to make football-shaped wedges.
Using decorating frosting, pipe football laces onto each wedge. Serve chilled.
